titleStmt.title: Victor H. Echorn to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1994

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Mustering and Disbursing Office,
Louisville, Ky., Nov. 17 1864
His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky.
Frankfort.
Sir:
I have the honor to make application for the appointment of Notary Public.

Particularly since the removal of this office into a locality where are several other public offices, but no Notary, the presence of one would be a great convience to officers coming here to be mustered, and would frequently expediate matters at this office materially.

I have the honor to be
Your Excellency's
Most obedient servant
Victor H. Echorn

Jefferson Co
Notary
V. N. Echorn
apptd 18th Nov/64
